IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: elementary and secondary school for boys grades 3- 12
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Heights School is a private, independent, preparatory school for boys, grades three to twelve. The School assists parents in the intellectual, moral, physical and spiritual education of their sons. Dedicated teachers impart rigorous academic training in all the major areas of the liberal arts. Formation in virtue fosters respect for every person, a desire to serve God and others, and an optimistic attitude towards life's challenges. The School's Christian orientation and spiritual formation are entrusted to Opus Dei, a Personal Prelature of the Catholic Church.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDE ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION TO 460 BOYS, GRADES 3-12, OVER COURSE OF 170-DAY SCHOOL YEAR. SERVICE PROGRAM INCLUDES CLASSROOM INSTRUCTION, EXTRACURRICULAR PROGRAMS, AND FAMILY SUPPORT ACTIVITIES.

Activity2.Description: Provide summer camp activities to 600 boys, ages 4-18 during the summer months of June, July and August. Service program includes camps for athletics, academic and enrichment subjects.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The School adopted the accounting standard on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes (FASB ASC Topic 740-10), which addresses the determination of whether tax benefits claimed or expected to be claimed on a tax return should be recorded in the financial statements. Under this guidance, the School may recognize the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more-likely-than-not that the tax position will be sustained on examination by taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the position. The tax benefits recognized in the financial statements from such a position are measured based on the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon ultimate settlement. The guidance on accounting for uncertainty in income taxes also addresses de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties on income taxes, and accounting in interim periods. Management evaluated the School's tax positions and concluded that the School had taken no uncertain tax positions that require adjustment to the financial statements to comply with the provisions of this guidance. The School files income tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction. With few exceptions, the School is no longer subject to income tax examinations by the U.S. federal, state or local tax authorities for years before 2007.
SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSE SHOWN NET OF REVENUE ON LINE 8B: 121130.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: the POLICY IS PUBLICIZED THROUGH PRINTED MATERIALS AND PERIODIC ADVERTISEMENTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The Board of the school determines the total amount of financial aid available for any given year, and leaves the process of calculating individual financial aid awards to management officials of the school. Financial aid is awarded by means of the following process: a) families of students who wish to be considered for financial aid make application online with a contracted grant & aid service, b) the results of that application are reviewed by a financial aid committee comprised of several management officials of the school, and c) a notice of financial aid award is sent to the family of the prospective student as part of an enrollment contract.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE SCHOOL UTILIZES A STOCKBROKER TO HANDLE THE SCHOOL'S INVESTMENT ACTIVITY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Denis Harper (Director) and Pat Cipollone (Director) are brothers-in-law.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Members shall protect and promote the original spirit and mission of the School. The number of Members shall not be less than five nor more than seven, serving a term of three years from the date of their election. Members may be elected at any regular or special meeting, with a vote of the majority of the Members deciding the matter.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: One of the The responsibilities of the members is the appointment and removal of the Board of Directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The members hold the responsibilities of the appointment and removal of the Board of Directors; the amendment of the Articles of Incorporation and the revision of the By-Laws; and the response to inquiries from the Board of Directors on matters relating to the spirit and mission of the School.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A review of the draft Form 990 will be conducted by the school's Business Manager prior to submission to the IRS. This review will consist of a careful examination of the return for accuracy, and discussion of any questions/concerns with the form preparers.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BY-LAWS OF THE HEIGHTS, INC. REQUIRE THAT DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, ADMINISTRATORS, FACULTY, AND OTHER EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL DISCLOSE ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THAT MAY EXIST IN CONNECTION WITH THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES AT THE SCHOOL, SO THAT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS CAN PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND TAKE APPROPRIATE ACTION. AS A MEANS TO MONITOR AND ENFORCE COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ANNUALLY DESCRIBING ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTERSET AND MEMBERSHIP ON OTHER BOARDS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE HEADMASTER IS THE KEY MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL FOR THE SCHOOL, AND THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING HIS COMPENSATION IS AS FOLLOWS: A) THE HEADMASTER MEETS WITH THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD ON OR BEFORE MAY 15TH FOR A FORMAL REVIEW OF THE JUST-COMPLETED SCHOOL YEAR, B) ANY ADJUSTMENT OF THE HEADMASTER'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED AS A RESULT OF THIS REVIEW, AND C) THE ADJUSTMENT MUST BE APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD PRIOR TO JUNE 30TH. THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER IS THE KEY FINANCIAL OFFICER FOR THE SCHOOL, AND THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING HIS COMPENSATION IS AS FOLLOWS: A) THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER MEETS WITH THE HEADMASTER ON OR BEFORE MAY 15TH FOR A FORMAL REVIEW OF THE JUST-COMPLETED SCHOOL YEAR, AND B) ANY ADJUSTMENT OF THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED AS A RESULT OF THIS REVIEW.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: UPON RECEIPT OF A WRITTEN REQUEST, AND WITH THE APPROVAL OF THE CHAIRMAN, HEADMASTER AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER, THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS OF THE SCHOOL ARE MADE AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION AT THE OFFICES OF THE SCHOOL.
